body:
I get this as well (Windows 11, too).  After updating to Bevy 0.17 (and updating a few other related dependencies like bevy_egui_inspector to 0.34).  Running on the multithreaded executor.

I have seen it alternately in:
  - `bevy::winit::system::despawn_windows` (which runs in `Last` schedule)
  - `bevy_egui::input::process_ime_system` (which runs in `PostUpdate`)

In both places, at the line like:

    WINIT_WINDOWS.with_borrow_mut(|winit_windows| { ... })

Maybe something to do with the change to using thread locals?

Both those places are using the new `NonSendMarker` system param though.  Not sure if there are any other *systems* that use the variable in the same schedules as those systems.  But it is also used quite extensively in the winit event loop.

If I comment out my DebugPlugin (which is where the egui plugins are used), the application starts normally.  Otherwise, I always get this error immediately when starting.

Looking at one stack trace I noticed that `WINIT_WINDOWS` is borrowed in `about_to_wait`, and the closure ends up calling (via `redraw_requested`) the `process_ime_system` system that tries to borrow it again?

That's in a Windows-only block, too.

[winit_windows_borrow.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22654918/winit_windows_borrow.txt)

Maybe the call to `redraw_requested` could be moved outside the borrow, since it doesn't directly use anything from it except the decision of whether to call it.

I have a pull request which I will submit... my first one ðŸ˜Ÿ .

issue.title: Avoid a "RefCell already borrowed" error with WINIT_WINDOWS

labels.name: A-Windowing
labels.description: Platform-agnostic interface layer to run your app in

labels.name: O-Windows
labels.description: Specific to the Windows desktop operating system

labels.name: S-Ready-For-Final-Review
labels.description: This PR has been approved by the community. It's ready for a maintainer to consider merging it

labels.name: D-Straightforward
labels.description: Simple bug fixes and API improvements, docs, test and examples

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

Fixes #21319.

## Solution

In the "about_to_wait" state of Bevy's winit event loop, we borrow WINIT_WINDOWS only to check the conditions for a redraw, and perform the call after that check is concluded.

## Testing

Tested by confirming that the RefCell error no longer occurs in my application.  In my application, the error occurred when the `bevy-egui-inspector` crate was used.

I do not know whether the original reporter of #21319 was also using third-party Bevy plugins that might have caused the issue.  It would be good if they could check whether this change fixes it for them.

Tested on Windows 11, where the bug is known to occur.  The code that was changed is only included in Windows builds so there is little need to test on other platforms.

body:
Hello @kumikaya, could you test my fix?  It's in my repo fork:  https://github.com/ejrh/bevy/tree/winit_windows_borrow

Let me know if you need help.
@joshua-holmes might be good to get your review of my analysis and PR #21338.
@ejrh , I tested your fix on your fork branch and the bug no longer occurs.
